We work together to solve complex problems. Behind the simplicity of every match, we think deeply about human relationships, behavioral science, network economics, AI and ML, online and real-world safety, cultural nuances, loneliness, love, sex, and more.

The Team or Role
We are seeking a dynamic and transformational Director of Business Development, Growth and Distribution to join our team. This role is crucial in crafting Tinder’s strategic partnerships, focusing on driving user and payer growth. You will report to the VP, Head of Strategy and Business Development at Tinder.

The Business Development team is a global team that identifies, structures, negotiates and manages significant partnership opportunities with strategic partners such as platforms, telcos, OEMs, and lifestyle sector leaders. We collaborate with a diverse set of teams and develop relationships to identify key markets and opportunities best aligned with the company's overall strategy and core user demographic.

Where you’ll work:
This is a hybrid role and requires in-office collaboration three days per week. This position is located in Los Angeles, San Francisco or Palo Alto, CA.

lists.content:
• Business Opportunity Identification: Develop and implement strategies to expand Tinder's user base and payer, in both existing and new markets. Use strong tech category knowledge and experience to identify new growth and distribution partners for expansion.
  • Partnership Development & Management: Forge and maintain strategic partnerships with growth and distribution partners. Develop a strong pipeline and relationships with potential partners, with a focus on credit/payment/digital subscription partners. Creatively structure deals that maximize value for all stakeholders, including user growth and brand support.  Negotiate and close deals that align with our strategic goals.  Operationalize deals, with cross functional support as needed.
  • Team Development: Lead a team of professionals in business development. Provide coaching, mentoring, alignment and professional development, fostering our high-performance culture.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with product, engineering, marketing, analytics and finance teams to complete business development activities that align with company-wide objectives.
  • Reporting and Analysis: Extensively use data to drive opportunity sizing and impact analysis. Provide regular reports on business development activities, progress and impact towards strategic goals.

• A minimum of 10 years of experience in business development, preferably in consumer tech
  • Proven track record of identifying and developing new business opportunities.
  • Strong negotiation and deal-making skills.
  • Excellent leadership and team-building abilities.
  • Exceptional analytical and critical thinking skills.
  • Strong experience in developing performance metrics for partnerships.
  • Exceptional collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to influence at all levels.

lists.text: As a full time employee you'll enjoy:
lists.content:
• Unlimited PTO (with no waiting period), 10 annual Wellness Days
  • Time off to volunteer and charitable donations matched up to $15,000 annually
  • Comprehensive health, vision, and dental coverage
  • 100% 401(k) employer match up to 10%, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
  • 100% paid parental leave (including for non-birthing parents), family forming benefits, and Milk Stork, which provides access to breast milk shipping for business travel, surrogacy, and employee relocation
  • Investment in your development: mentorship through our MentorMatch program, access to 6,000+ online courses through Udemy, and an annual $3,000 stipend for your professional development
  • Investment in your wellness: access to mental health support via Modern Health, BetterHelp, and Insight Timer; paid concierge medical membership, pet insurance, fitness membership subsidy, and commuter subsidy
  • $500 work-from-home stipend to set you up for remote work
  • Free subscription to Tinder Gold

salaryDescription: Factors such as scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, job-related skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and business considerations may influence base pay offered. This salary range is reflective of a position based in Los Angeles. This salary will be subject to a geographic adjustment (according to a specific city and state), if an authorization is granted to work outside of the location listed in this posting.

#LI-MG1


Why Match Group?

Our mission is simple – to help people find love and happiness! We love our employees too and understand the importance of all life's milestones.  Here are some of the benefits we are proud to offer: 

Mind & Body – Medical, mental health, and wellness benefits to support your overall health and well-being
Financial Wellness – Competitive compensation, 100% employer match on 401k contributions up to 10% (cap at $10,000), as well as an employee stock purchase program to help you feel supported in your financial security
Unplug – Generous PTO and 18 paid holidays so you can unplug
Career – Annual training allowance for professional development and ERG membership opportunities and events so you feel connected and empowered in your work
Family – Families come in all shapes and sizes so we offer 20 weeks of 100% paid parental leave, fertility, adoption, and child care resources, as well as pet insurance and discounts  
Company Gatherings – We host fun happy hours and company events where our employees get to know each other 	and build a sense of connection and belonging!

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we value the rich dynamics that diversity brings to our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sexual orientation, sex (including pregnancy and sexual harassment), gender identity or expression, uniformed service or veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.  Period. 

If you require reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, or a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, please contact employeebenefits@matchgroup.com.

descriptionPlain:
We are looking for a Director of Procurement to join our team! This position will report to the Sr. Director of Corporate Finance & Procurement.  The Director of Procurement will be instrumental in helping to build the foundation of procurement while also analyzing and negotiating large contracts. 

Match Group, through its portfolio companies, is a leading provider of dating products available globally. Our international portfolio of brands includes Tinder, Match, Meetic, Hinge, PlentyOfFish, as well as a number of other brands, each designed to increase our users' likelihood of finding a meaningful connection.

***This role is a hybrid position. We work IRL three days a week***
description:
We are looking for a Director of Procurement to join our team! This position will report to the Sr. Director of Corporate Finance & Procurement. The Director of Procurement will be instrumental in helping to build the foundation of procurement while also analyzing and negotiating large contracts.

Match Group, through its portfolio companies, is a leading provider of dating products available globally. Our international portfolio of brands includes Tinder, Match, Meetic, Hinge, PlentyOfFish, as well as a number of other brands, each designed to increase our users' likelihood of finding a meaningful connection.

***This role is a hybrid position. We work IRL three days a week***

lists.content:
• You will build meaningful and trusted relationships with key internal stakeholders across business units and functions
  • You will lead contract negotiations and the contract negotiation process securing advantageous contracts
  • You will lead communications with global stakeholders, including executives, to ensure best-in-class category management, which drives favorable vendor relationships and commercial outcomes
  • You will establish operational and financial Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to achieve business outcomes
  • You will partner with the Sr. Director of Procurement to develop procurement operations strategies, policies, tools and operations to ensure that all purchases are made in an efficient, controlled, and approved manner

lists.text: We could be a match if:
lists.content:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience
  • You have experience building a procurement function
  • You have 8+ years of progressive procurement or strategic sourcing experience with global exposure
  • You have a deep experience in contract negotiation and vendor relationship management
  • You are an expert at devising and implementing procurement processes and procedures
  • You have excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities
  • You have the ability to thrive in ambiguous work environments
  • You have experience working in a procurement team for a dynamic technology company

• Our team is hard working but fun.  We don't take ourselves too seriously and are constantly looking for ways to improve everything we do
  • Successful individuals on this team are driven to meet and exceed goals & possess the ability to juggle several projects and requests with exceptional time management skills

descriptionPlain:
Operationalize the Growth team’s processes and approach on a global scale. Create alignment with cross-functional leaders in engineering, data science, design, marketing, and member experience. Lead the Growth teams in setting their goals, success metrics and roadmaps, ensuring they align with the brand’s mission and drive maximum impact for the business. Deeply understand the brand’s (Tinder's) business and the metrics that impact the performance while pushing the teams to develop a deeper product sense for what makes members more successful on the app. Identify new opportunities and forge partnerships with other teams across the brand by understanding their goals. Use strong communication skills (written and verbal) to communicate Growth roadmaps, priorities, experiments, and decisions across a wide spectrum of audiences from partner teams to executive levels. Responsible for setting and owning the long-term strategy for the User Growth group based on the company's objectives and insights gathered from experimentation and user testing. Position allows telecommuting from anywhere in the U.S. Salary: $161,000 - $280,000 per year. 
 
Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s degree or U.S. equivalent in Business Administration, Telecommunications Engineering, Computer Science, Information Science, Management Information Systems or a related Field plus 5 years of professional experience as Product Manager, Group Product Manager, or any occupation/position/job title involving product management in the consumer tech industry. Must also have the following: 3 years of professional experience performing product management in consumer technology (including driving product strategy and coordinating with cross-functional teams) to support product launches and growth; 3 years of professional experience leading product teams for consumer mobile apps or social networking businesses; 3 years of professional experience analyzing consumer behavior, user experience design, user research methods and consumer product fundamentals and frameworks; 3 years of professional experience launching data-driven consumer products; 3 years of professional experience defining metrics and making product and strategic decisions based on A/B testing and qualitative user insights; 3 years of professional experience delivering quarterly results and orchestrating the adoption of new technologies, processes, and tools across the organization.
 
Please email resume to: Lauren.Lozano@Match.com. Please specify ad code JSLL.

Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s degree or U.S. equivalent in Business Administration, Telecommunications Engineering, Computer Science, Information Science, Management Information Systems or a related Field plus 5 years of professional experience as Product Manager, Group Product Manager, or any occupation/position/job title involving product management in the consumer tech industry. Must also have the following: 3 years of professional experience performing product management in consumer technology (including driving product strategy and coordinating with cross-functional teams) to support product launches and growth; 3 years of professional experience leading product teams for consumer mobile apps or social networking businesses; 3 years of professional experience analyzing consumer behavior, user experience design, user research methods and consumer product fundamentals and frameworks; 3 years of professional experience launching data-driven consumer products; 3 years of professional experience defining metrics and making product and strategic decisions based on A/B testing and qualitative user insights; 3 years of professional experience delivering quarterly results and orchestrating the adoption of new technologies, processes, and tools across the organization.
 
Please email resume to: Lauren.Lozano@Match.com. Please specify ad code JSLL.
descriptionBodyPlain:
Operationalize the Growth team’s processes and approach on a global scale. Create alignment with cross-functional leaders in engineering, data science, design, marketing, and member experience. Lead the Growth teams in setting their goals, success metrics and roadmaps, ensuring they align with the brand’s mission and drive maximum impact for the business. Deeply understand the brand’s (Tinder's) business and the metrics that impact the performance while pushing the teams to develop a deeper product sense for what makes members more successful on the app. Identify new opportunities and forge partnerships with other teams across the brand by understanding their goals. Use strong communication skills (written and verbal) to communicate Growth roadmaps, priorities, experiments, and decisions across a wide spectrum of audiences from partner teams to executive levels. Responsible for setting and owning the long-term strategy for the User Growth group based on the company's objectives and insights gathered from experimentation and user testing. Position allows telecommuting from anywhere in the U.S. Salary: $161,000 - $280,000 per year. 
 
Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s degree or U.S. equivalent in Business Administration, Telecommunications Engineering, Computer Science, Information Science, Management Information Systems or a related Field plus 5 years of professional experience as Product Manager, Group Product Manager, or any occupation/position/job title involving product management in the consumer tech industry. Must also have the following: 3 years of professional experience performing product management in consumer technology (including driving product strategy and coordinating with cross-functional teams) to support product launches and growth; 3 years of professional experience leading product teams for consumer mobile apps or social networking businesses; 3 years of professional experience analyzing consumer behavior, user experience design, user research methods and consumer product fundamentals and frameworks; 3 years of professional experience launching data-driven consumer products; 3 years of professional experience defining metrics and making product and strategic decisions based on A/B testing and qualitative user insights; 3 years of professional experience delivering quarterly results and orchestrating the adoption of new technologies, processes, and tools across the organization.
 
Please email resume to: Lauren.Lozano@Match.com. Please specify ad code JSLL.

descriptionPlain:
Our Mission

As humans, there are few things more exciting than meeting someone new. At Tinder, we’re inspired by the challenge of keeping the magic of human connection alive. With tens of millions of users, hundreds of millions of downloads, 2+ billion swipes per day, 20+ million matches per day, and a presence in 190+ countries, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing.
 
We work together to solve complex problems. Behind the simplicity of every match, we think deeply about human relationships, behavioral science, network economics, AI and ML, online and real-world safety, cultural nuances, loneliness, love, sex, and more.

As the iOS Engineering Manager for User Growth at Tinder, you will have an outsized impact by leading the team that builds new, user-facing features related to user acquisitions, activations, retention, and new user education. You’ll have the opportunity to manage and lead a team of 8 iOS engineers building one of the most foundational aspects of the Tinder app: our long term user growth. We are deeply invested in challenging norms, constantly improving architecture designs, exploring emergent tech and ideas, and leveraging new technologies in interesting ways to deliver an app that is used by millions across the globe.

Where you'll work: This is a hybrid role and requires in-office collaboration three times per week in our Palo Alto, California office.

You’ll have the opportunity to manage and lead a team of 8 iOS engineers building one of the most foundational aspects of the Tinder app: our long term user growth. We are deeply invested in challenging norms, constantly improving architecture designs, exploring emergent tech and ideas, and leveraging new technologies in interesting ways to deliver an app that is used by millions across the globe.

Where you'll work: This is a hybrid role and requires in-office collaboration three times per week in our Palo Alto, California office.

lists.content:
• Lead a team of 8 iOS engineers to build consumer-facing features that reach millions of users globally and help create the optimal Tinder experience for our members.
  • Define and own platform objectives and key metrics, developing a strategic roadmap for your team.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional/platform teams to execute the roadmap, delivering high-quality results promptly.
  • Drive technical, design and product discussions with teams across the organization to define and scope requirements.
  • Establish the technical direction for the team and lead the team to achieve it.
  • Lead and mentor team members to help them reach their full potential.

• 7+ years of professional experience building native iOS applications.
  • 2+ year(s) of experience leading mobile engineering teams.
  • Significant experience with Swift, understanding concepts like structs, data classes, optionals, generics, concurrency, etc.
  • Familiarity with architecture patterns such as MVVM, VIPER, MVI, RIBs, and their applications.
  • Proven experience leading a team in building and shipping large-scale mobile apps.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Ability to inspire and motivate the team to exceed expectations.

• Experience developing frequently updated apps for consumer products.
  • Experience with modern building tools such as Gradle and Bazel and CI/CD process.
  • Experience with modern UI toolkits such as SwiftUI.
  • Comfortable working with legacy code and implementing effective strategies for improvement.
  • Ability to communicate and implement solutions-oriented improvements.
  • Experience collaborating within a small team while working interdependently within a cross-functional organization.

descriptionPlain:
Our Mission

As humans, there are few things more exciting than meeting someone new. At Tinder, we’re inspired by the challenge of keeping the magic of human connection alive. With tens of millions of users, hundreds of millions of downloads, 2+ billion swipes per day, 20+ million matches per day, and a presence in 190+ countries, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing.
 
We work together to solve complex problems. Behind the simplicity of every match, we think deeply about human relationships, behavioral science, network economics, AI and ML, online and real-world safety, cultural nuances, loneliness, love, sex, and more.

We are currently seeking a Mobile Engineering Manager to join our Trust & Safety engineering team. In this role, you will lead a team of 5-8 Android and iOS engineers, focusing on enhancing account authenticity, mitigating adversarial impact, building public trust, and enabling safer experiences for millions of users globally on Tinder. You will have an opportunity to lead a mobile team that is deeply invested in improving architecture designs, exploring emerging ideas, and leveraging technologies in interesting ways to help support one of our primary missions: ensuring that Tinder remains the safest place to meet new people. 

Where you’ll work:
This is a hybrid role and requires in-office collaboration three times per week. Our offices are located in West Hollywood, San Francisco, or Palo Alto, CA.

descriptionPlain:
Founded in Vancouver, Canada in 2003, Plenty of Fish is one of the early pioneers in the online dating industry, with one of the largest and most diverse communities of singles. We're one of the top revenue-driving brands in the Match Group (comprised of Tinder, OkCupid, Hinge and Match.com).

We love what we do, and have the ability to profoundly impact millions of people's lives every single day! Named one of BC’s Top Employers, Plenty of Fish is a great place to build friendships, grow your career and collaborate with top talent.

We work hybrid at Plenty of Fish - IRL in our downtown Vancouver office Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday and work remotely the remainder of the week!

We are looking for an experienced hands-on Engineering Team Lead for our Monetization team at Plenty of Fish. The Monetization team plays a pivotal role in strategically optimizing revenue streams, elevating user experiences, and driving financial success. Through a combination of data-driven insights, collaborative efforts, and adaptability, the team is dedicated to continuous innovation and evolution in the dynamic landscape of online dating. In this role you will be responsible for delivering new product features, creating and maintaining systems, triaging issues, evaluating new technologies, and planning the strategic direction of the engineering team.

We are looking for an experienced hands-on Engineering Team Lead for our Monetization team at Plenty of Fish. The Monetization team plays a pivotal role in strategically optimizing revenue streams, elevating user experiences, and driving financial success. Through a combination of data-driven insights, collaborative efforts, and adaptability, the team is dedicated to continuous innovation and evolution in the dynamic landscape of online dating. In this role you will be responsible for delivering new product features, creating and maintaining systems, triaging issues, evaluating new technologies, and planning the strategic direction of the engineering team.

lists.content:
• Manage a cross functional team of engineers, including full-stack, mobile, database, etc.
  • Establish and manage project plans, timelines, schedules, team structure and resourcing
  • Contribute to hands-on development as well as being the thought leader for designing systems within your domain
  • Own business and operational metrics for your team’s domain
  • Ensure high quality and timely releases of features/products to market
  • Increase end to end efficiency of the software development life cycle and focusing team on delivery & quality
  • Support the creation and ongoing communication of a technical vision for your team’s domain
  • Develop management systems for team’s domain
  • Lead all aspects of your team’s development and growth; evaluating individual and team performance
  • Research and advocate for the adoption of industry standard tools and technologies
  • Foster a sense of community amongst the team and within the larger Vancouver tech market

lists.text: You'll be a match for this role if you have..
lists.content:
• Minimum of 7 years software development experience with at least 2 years in a technical leadership capacity
  • 1 + year(s) of experience managing people and projects with a proven track record of successful and timely delivery
  • Good understanding of architectural patterns and ability to to design systems to solve complex problems at scale
  • Experience with .NET Core, Domain Driven Design,  Micro-Services and Event Driven systems 
  • Experience with at least one client platform - Android, iOS, or React 
  • Commercial experience with consumer product development (B2C)
  • Demonstrable experience with Agile methodologies
  • Strong project management skills
  • Strong communication skills

Our mission is simple – to help people find love and happiness! We love our employees too and understand the importance of all life's milestones.  Here are some of the benefits we are proud to offer: 

Mind & Body – Medical, mental health, and wellness benefits to support your overall health and well-being
Financial Wellness – Competitive compensation, 100% employer match on 401k contributions up to 10% (cap at $10,000), as well as an employee stock purchase program to help you feel supported in your financial security
Unplug – Generous PTO and 18 paid holidays so you can unplug
Career – Annual training allowance for professional development and ERG membership opportunities and events so you feel connected and empowered in your work
Family – Families come in all shapes and sizes so we offer 20 weeks of 100% paid parental leave, fertility, adoption, and child care resources, as well as pet insurance and discounts  
Company Gatherings – We host fun happy hours and company events where our employees get to know each other 	and build a sense of connection and belonging!

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we value the rich dynamics that diversity brings to our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sexual orientation, sex (including pregnancy and sexual harassment), gender identity or expression, uniformed service or veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.  Period. 

If you require reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, or a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, please contact employeebenefits@matchgroup.com.

descriptionPlain:
Know where you belong. 

We pioneered the online dating industry as Match.com in 1995. Even though we've dropped the ".com", Match Evergreen & Emerging brands still bring millions of singles together to find love through our apps like BLK, Chispa and OurTime. Creating a sense of belonging doesn't stop at our products - it's the foundation of every team we hire.  

We're looking for an Executive Assistant to join our team! As Executive Assistant, you will be supporting members of the Evergreen & Emerging Leadership Team. This will include calendar management, travel and event planning and coordination, expense reports, contract database management, team activities, and other ad hoc projects as needed. 

***This role is a hybrid position. We work IRL in our Dallas office three days a week***
description:
Know where you belong.

We pioneered the online dating industry as Match.com in 1995. Even though we've dropped the ".com", Match Evergreen & Emerging brands still bring millions of singles together to find love through our apps like BLK, Chispa and OurTime. Creating a sense of belonging doesn't stop at our products - it's the foundation of every team we hire.

We're looking for an Executive Assistant to join our team! As Executive Assistant, you will be supporting members of the Evergreen & Emerging Leadership Team. This will include calendar management, travel and event planning and coordination, expense reports, contract database management, team activities, and other ad hoc projects as needed.

***This role is a hybrid position. We work IRL in our Dallas office three days a week***

lists.content:
• You will manage calendars, schedule interdepartmental meetings and events
  • You will coordinate with outside parties as necessary, including catering and site selection, as well as submit expense reports
  • You will support our Evergreen & Emerging Brands CEO as well as other leadership team members
  • You will coordinate with other Executive Assistants
  • You will make travel arrangements; including air, land and accommodations (extensive domestic and international travel) and you will assist with booking travel for candidates and guests on an as needed basis
  • You will interface with a broad range of employees as well as executives across our global portfolio of brands and provide assistance on presentations and reports, draft memos and other correspondence as needed
  • You will be responsible for assisting with any group needs as well as planning group events
  • You will be asked to assist on special projects as needed as well as lead our weekly stand-up meetings

lists.text: We could be a match if:
lists.content:
• You have at least 5 years of experience as an executive assistant in a fast-paced environment
  • You have a self-motivated and proactive attitude
  • You are someone who is willing to roll up their sleeves with an optimistic approach
  • You have advanced level Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint skills; Experience with Google Suite 
  • You are adaptable, open to change and can be flexible in supporting additional executives when needed and can work outside of traditional business hours, if needed
  • You possess a strong customer service orientation and the ability to handle external and internal clients with professionalism and maturity and you enjoy working in a fast-paced environment under sometimes challenging time constraints
  • Bachelor’s degree is a plus

• Match has been recognized as a "Top 100 Places to Work" by Dallas Morning News!
  • You will be joining a fun, dynamic, and fast-paced culture
  • Successful individuals in this role are proactive, organized, self-directed, and can prioritize multiple projects while maintaining strict confidentiality

descriptionPlain:
As Executive Assistant, you will be supporting the Chief Legal Officer and other members of the legal leadership team. This will include calendar management, travel and event planning and coordination, expense reports, contract database management, team activities, and other ad hoc projects.  

Match Group, through its portfolio companies, is a leading provider of dating products available globally. Our portfolio of brands includes Tinder, Match, OkCupid, Hinge, Hyperconnect, as well as a number of other brands, each designed to increase our users' likelihood of finding a meaningful connection.

***This role is a hybrid position. We work IRL in our Dallas office three days a week***

additionalPlain:
As a member of our team, you’ll enjoy:

401(k) Matching: We match 100% of the first 10% of pre-tax 401(k) contributions you make, up to a maximum of $10,000 per year.

Professional Growth: Get a $3,000 annual Learning & Development stipend once you’ve been with us for three months. You also get free access to Udemy, an online learning and teaching marketplace with over 6000 courses, starting your first day.

Parental Leave & Planning: When you become a new parent, you’re eligible for 100% paid parental leave (20 paid weeks for both birth and non-birth parents.)

Fertility Support: You’ll get easy access to fertility care through Carrot, from basic treatments to fertility preservation. We also provide $10,000 toward fertility preservation. You and your spouse/domestic partner are both eligible.

Date Stipend: All Hinge employees receive a $100 monthly stipend for epic dates– Romantic or otherwise. Hinge Premium is also free for employees and their loved ones.

ERGs: We have eight Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)—Asian, Unapologetic, Disability, LGBTQIA+, Vibras, Women/Nonbinary, Parents, and Remote—that hold regular meetings, host events, and provide dedicated support to the organization & its community.

At Hinge, our core values are…

Authenticity: We share, never hide, our words, actions and intentions.

Courage: We embrace lofty goals and tough challenges.

Empathy: We deeply consider the perspective of others.

Diversity inspires innovation

Hinge is an equal-opportunity employer. We value diversity at our company and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We believe success is created by a diverse workforce of individuals with different ideas, strengths, interests, and cultural backgrounds.

If you require reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, or a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, please contact employeebenefits@matchgroup.com.

descriptionPlain:
Hinge is the dating app designed to be deleted

In today's digital world, finding genuine relationships is tougher than ever. At Hinge, we’re on a mission to inspire intimate connection to create a less lonely world. We’re obsessed with understanding our users’ behaviors to help them find love, and our success is defined by one simple metric– setting up great dates. With tens of millions of users across the globe, we’ve become the most trusted way to find a relationship, for all.

About the Role

We are seeking a Full-Stack Engineer III to join our team at Hinge. 

As a key member of our team, you will play a vital role in developing and maintaining internal tools essential for our Trust & Safety Ops team. Your focus will be on providing our moderation team with the necessary information to make effective decisions for user safety. Collaborating within a cross-disciplinary team, including data engineers, product managers, technical project managers, designers, and QA specialists, you will work closely with the Tech Lead and peers to advance our product and contribute to our engineering community. This role offers the opportunity to do high-impact work, directly contributing to user safety by enabling teams to work more efficiently. Given the current phase of maturity for our internal tools, you will have ample opportunities to shape and expand the product while broadening its scope.

About the Role

We are seeking a Full-Stack Engineer III to join our team at Hinge. 

As a key member of our team, you will play a vital role in developing and maintaining internal tools essential for our Trust & Safety Ops team. Your focus will be on providing our moderation team with the necessary information to make effective decisions for user safety. Collaborating within a cross-disciplinary team, including data engineers, product managers, technical project managers, designers, and QA specialists, you will work closely with the Tech Lead and peers to advance our product and contribute to our engineering community. This role offers the opportunity to do high-impact work, directly contributing to user safety by enabling teams to work more efficiently. Given the current phase of maturity for our internal tools, you will have ample opportunities to shape and expand the product while broadening its scope.

lists.content:
• Collaborate with a cross-disciplinary team to build features.
  • Build tooling and user interfaces for our web application to support Moderation, Appeals and Support team members in managing users on our platform.
  • Design and build backend/frontend features with an emphasis on quality and scalability.
  • Own projects end-to-end, and effectively communicate with tech leads, managers and other stakeholders.
  • Work in a cloud-native tech stack: Kubernetes, AWS, Go gRPC/API services, Postgres, Redis, Kafka, React.
  • Participate and engage in team ceremonies/processes and our on-call rotation (weeklong alternating with other engineers).

• Proficient in coding in one or more backend languages with a preference on Go
  • 3+ years experience with architecting RESTful APIs while following best practices
  • 2+ years experience with building and maintaining React web applications (Javascript/Typescript, CSS)
  • Worked with at least one message or event-based technology (Kafka, Kinesis, RabbitMQ, SQS, etc.)
  • Experience working in distributed production systems
  • Familiar with Cloud infrastructure and microservice architecture (such as AWS, GCP, Azure)
  • Familiar with CI/CD pipelines and testing frameworks (Mocha/Jest)
  • Knowledgeable of the Software Development Life Cycle
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Clear written & verbal communicator
  • Adept at explaining complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences

salaryDescription: Factors such as scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, job-related skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and business considerations may influence base pay offered. This salary range is reflective of a position based in New York City. This salary will be subject to a geographic adjustment (according to a specific city and state), if an authorization is granted to work outside of the location listed in this posting.

descriptionPlain:
Our Mission

As humans, there are few things more exciting than meeting someone new. At Tinder, we’re inspired by the challenge of keeping the magic of human connection alive. With tens of millions of users, hundreds of millions of downloads, 2+ billion swipes per day, 20+ million matches per day, and a presence in 190+ countries, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing.
 
We work together to solve complex problems. Behind the simplicity of every match, we think deeply about human relationships, behavioral science, network economics, AI and ML, online and real-world safety, cultural nuances, loneliness, love, sex, and more.

Tinder brings people together. With tens of millions of users and a presence in every country on earth, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing. Your work here can change the world.  

Our Global Escalations team, within the Member Experience org, is dedicated to supporting and  protecting our user base. We are looking for a Global Escalations Specialist to help us handle member escalations spanning trust & safety and support policy.  

Our Global Escalations team investigates safety issues, abuse, bugs & app functionality issues on the platform, along with enforcing Tinder's Community Guidelines and Terms of Service.
description:
Our Mission

As humans, there are few things more exciting than meeting someone new. At Tinder, we’re inspired by the challenge of keeping the magic of human connection alive. With tens of millions of users, hundreds of millions of downloads, 2+ billion swipes per day, 20+ million matches per day, and a presence in 190+ countries, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing.
 
We work together to solve complex problems. Behind the simplicity of every match, we think deeply about human relationships, behavioral science, network economics, AI and ML, online and real-world safety, cultural nuances, loneliness, love, sex, and more.

Tinder brings people together. With tens of millions of users and a presence in every country on earth, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing. Your work here can change the world.  

Our Global Escalations team, within the Member Experience org, is dedicated to supporting and  protecting our user base. We are looking for a Global Escalations Specialist to help us handle member escalations spanning trust & safety and support policy.  

Our Global Escalations team investigates safety issues, abuse, bugs & app functionality issues on the platform, along with enforcing Tinder's Community Guidelines and Terms of Service.

lists.content:
• Protect our ecosystem, prevent fraudulent activity, enforce our TOS, and help improve the Tinder experience
  • Investigate, troubleshoot, and drive our most sensitive complex escalations to resolution, spanning topics across Trust & Safety and member support
  • Investigate bug and app functionality reports and work with Engineering to help them resolve issues
  • Collect user feedback on new product and feature rollouts
  • Be comfortable dealing with high pressure issues, gray areas and policy/process changes
  • Address sensitive content issues (graphic content, hate speech, etc.)
  • Communicate & co-ordinate with cross-functional partners across Member Experience, Engineering, Comms, Marketing, Legal, outsourced partner teams and more
  • Contribute to or own organizational projects and consistently drive process improvements to support the team’s goals and objectives.

• Minimum of 2+ years in a similar role
  • Basic knowledge of Zendesk
  • Ability to understand and summarize complex cases quickly
  • Outstanding analytical skills and excellent judgment
  • Highly flexible and adaptable
  • Ability to multitask, keep up with large volumes of emails in a fast-paced environment
  • Outstanding time management and prioritization skills
  • Quick learner
  • Great teammate
  • Tech savvy
  • Strong attention to details
  • Passion for helping people
  • Ability to use critical thinking and logic to isolate and resolve issues
  • Bachelor degree or higher or equivalent

lists.text: As a full-time employee, you'll enjoy:
lists.content:
• 15 days of PTO, 10 annual Wellness Days
  • Time off to volunteer and charitable donations matched up to $15,000 annually 
  • Comprehensive health, vision, and dental coverage
  • 100% 401(k) employer match up to 10%, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
  • 100% paid parental leave (including for non-birthing parents) and family forming benefits
  • Investment in your development: mentorship through our MentorMatch program, access to 6,000+ online courses through Udemy, and an annual $3,000 stipend for your professional development
  • Investment in your wellness: access to mental health support via Modern Health, paid concierge medical membership, pet insurance, fitness membership subsidy, and commuter subsidy
  • Free subscription to Tinder Gold

opening:
Our Mission

As humans, there are few things more exciting than meeting someone new. At Tinder, we’re inspired by the challenge of keeping the magic of human connection alive. With tens of millions of users, hundreds of millions of downloads, 2+ billion swipes per day, 20+ million matches per day, and a presence in 190+ countries, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing.
 
We work together to solve complex problems. Behind the simplicity of every match, we think deeply about human relationships, behavioral science, network economics, AI and ML, online and real-world safety, cultural nuances, loneliness, love, sex, and more.

descriptionBody:
Tinder brings people together. With tens of millions of users and a presence in every country on earth, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing. Your work here can change the world.  

Our Global Escalations team, within the Member Experience org, is dedicated to supporting and  protecting our user base. We are looking for a Global Escalations Specialist to help us handle member escalations spanning trust & safety and support policy.  

Our Global Escalations team investigates safety issues, abuse, bugs & app functionality issues on the platform, along with enforcing Tinder's Community Guidelines and Terms of Service.

descriptionPlain:
Azar Global Marketing Team 소개

◾ Azar Global Marketing Team은 전 세계 #1 비디오챗 & 소셜 디스커버리 앱, 아자르의 유저유입 및 브랜딩 캠페인을 책임지고 있으며 유럽, 중동, 아시아, 북미지역을 커버하고 항상 더 많은 나라로의 진출을 모색하고 있습니다.


Azar Global Marketing Team에 오시면 이런 점이 좋아요

◾ 타 기업과는 다르게 해외에서도 좋은 성과를 내고있는 서비스인 아자르를 통해 진정한 Global B2C 마케팅 경험을 쌓을 수 있으며, 각 국가의 사업 담당자들과 인싸이트 교류가 가능합니다.
◾ 마케팅 업무뿐 아니라 Product를 만들고 운영하는 과정을 보고 아이디어 공유도 가능해 빠르게 스스로를 성장시킬 수 있습니다.
◾ 스튜디오 내에서 기획, 개발, 디자인 조직과 긴밀하게 논의하고, 판단하고, 실행할 수 있는 동시에, 광고, 크리에이티브, AI나 media 등 공통 조직과 다양한 협업 경험을 쌓을 수 있습니다.
◾ 유저 피드백과 마켓 리서치를 기반으로 다양한 캠페인을 테스트 해보고 더 좋은 결과를 낼 수 있는 방법을 함께 고민하고, 고민한 내용을 직접 실행할 수 있습니다.
description:
Azar Global Marketing Team 소개

◾ Azar Global Marketing Team은 전 세계 #1 비디오챗 & 소셜 디스커버리 앱, 아자르의 유저유입 및 브랜딩 캠페인을 책임지고 있으며 유럽, 중동, 아시아, 북미지역을 커버하고 항상 더 많은 나라로의 진출을 모색하고 있습니다.


Azar Global Marketing Team에 오시면 이런 점이 좋아요

◾ 타 기업과는 다르게 해외에서도 좋은 성과를 내고있는 서비스인 아자르를 통해 진정한 Global B2C 마케팅 경험을 쌓을 수 있으며, 각 국가의 사업 담당자들과 인싸이트 교류가 가능합니다.
◾ 마케팅 업무뿐 아니라 Product를 만들고 운영하는 과정을 보고 아이디어 공유도 가능해 빠르게 스스로를 성장시킬 수 있습니다.
◾ 스튜디오 내에서 기획, 개발, 디자인 조직과 긴밀하게 논의하고, 판단하고, 실행할 수 있는 동시에, 광고, 크리에이티브, AI나 media 등 공통 조직과 다양한 협업 경험을 쌓을 수 있습니다.
◾ 유저 피드백과 마켓 리서치를 기반으로 다양한 캠페인을 테스트 해보고 더 좋은 결과를 낼 수 있는 방법을 함께 고민하고, 고민한 내용을 직접 실행할 수 있습니다.

lists.content:
• 팀 KPI 달성을 위해 해외 마케팅 전략 및 캠페인들을 팀 멤버들과 함께 수립: 온/오프라인 광고, PR, 인플루언서 캠페인, 유저 이벤트, 코프로모션 등 포함
  • 주어진 팀 예산 배정, ROI 예측, 지출사항 기록과 ROI 업데이트
  • 법무, 회계팀을 통해 캠페인 세부사항 법무 체크 및 예산 승인 작업
  • 마케팅 캠페인 타임라인 설계 후 데드라인에 맞춰 시행
  • 디지털 마케팅 팀과 협업을 통한 퍼포먼스 마케팅  캠페인 준비 및 최적화
  • 크리에이티브팀과 외부 에이전시와의 협업을 통한 마케팅 소재 제작및 최적화
  • 캠페인 런칭 후 데이터 분석을 통해 캠페인 최적화 작업
  • 팀/캠페인 업데이트 사항 주/월/분기/반기별 보고서 작성
  • 유기적으로 변하는 현지 사항을 주기적으로 모니터링 하며 적절한 대응방안 제시 및 실행
  • 이 외 팀에서 지정하는 특별한 마케팅 업무가 포함될수 있습니다

• 학사 이상의 학위를 소지하신 분
  • 4년 이상의 마케팅 업무 경험을 보유하신 분
  • Fluent한 영어 실력을 보유하신 분
  • 퍼포먼스 마케팅 경험이 있으신 분
• SQL 사용 경험이 있으신 분

• 고용 형태: 정규직
  • 채용 절차: 서류전형 > 1차 면접 > 2차 면접 > 3차면접(해당 시) > 최종 합격
  • 근무 시간: 근무시간을 자율적으로 선택하는DIY(Do It Yourself) 근무제
  • 지원 서류: 자유 양식의 상세 경력기반 국문 또는 영문이력서(PDF)

• 하이퍼커넥트는 증명사진, 주민등록번호, 가족관계, 혼인여부 등 채용과 관계없는 개인정보를 요구하지 않습니다.
  • 수습기간 중 급여 등 처우에 차등이 없습니다.
  • 제출해 주신 내용 중 허위 사실이 있을 경우 채용이 취소될 수 있습니다.
  • 필요 시 사전에 안내된 채용 절차 외에도 추가 면접 전형이 진행될 수 있습니다.
  • 필요 시 지원자의 동의 하에 평판조회 절차가 진행될 수 있으며, 평판조회 결과에 따라 채용이 취소될 수 있습니다.
  • 병역특례요원의 경우, 병역특례 관련법에 따라 복무관리를 진행합니다.

descriptionPlain:
Our Mission

As humans, there are few things more exciting than meeting someone new. At Tinder, we’re inspired by the challenge of keeping the magic of human connection alive. With tens of millions of users, hundreds of millions of downloads, 2+ billion swipes per day, 20+ million matches per day, and a presence in 190+ countries, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing.

We are looking for a brand leader for Japan to shape and grow Tinder business and brand. This is a high-impact role that will report directly to the Tinder VP of Asia.
description:
Our Mission

As humans, there are few things more exciting than meeting someone new. At Tinder, we’re inspired by the challenge of keeping the magic of human connection alive. With tens of millions of users, hundreds of millions of downloads, 2+ billion swipes per day, 20+ million matches per day, and a presence in 190+ countries, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing.

We are looking for a brand leader for Japan to shape and grow Tinder business and brand. This is a high-impact role that will report directly to the Tinder VP of Asia.

lists.content:
• Set Tinder Japan's brand KPI and translate into multi-year integrated marketing strategies and campaigns to achieve brand growth including revenue, user, equity.
  • Build, inspire and lead a Tinder Japan team to drive and execute GTM plans. Leads team in operating with a growth and team-first mindset, with clearly defined roles, career paths.
  • Annual and quarterly marketing planning including investment strategies, brand campaign, partnerships, media strategy and marketing innovations.
  • Lead the creation of impactful marketing collateral, content, and messaging that resonates with target audience.
  • Closely monitor ecosystem health and implement right CRM, Product marketing strategy to maximize user experience and monetization opportunities.
  • Partner with communications team to deliver proactive PR strategy.

• Proven experience in building and shaping the world’s best consumer brands. Ideally with experience on brand focused on youth, culture or digital.
  • Strong business acumen with proven track record of driving revenue growth
  • Collaborate team player with experience in leading the team, by setting clear and challenging goals.
  • Experience of making data-informed business and marketing strategies with effective analytical thinking
  • A proven track record across all marketing disciplines with full funnel consumer experience

• Delivering the Japanese market growth strategy, targets and brand health of the Tinder brand in Japan.
  • Delivering marketing efficacy against country goals and fiscal management of all budgets etc.
  • Leading the Japanese marketing team, responsible for operational structure, performance reviews and growth plans of each team member.
  • Managing a marketing budget of which you can allocate as needed to different initiatives to deliver against Japan market goals.
  • Overseeing the execution of Tinder Japan marketing initiatives, including localized CRM, PR, growth, brand, performance and influencer marketing.
  • Collaborating with other cross-functional teams within Tinder (product/engineering, other regions, and other Match Group brands).
  • Delivering a clear understanding of local consumer insights as it relates to product usage and needs, cultural nuances and user behaviour.
  • Managing Press Relations and Government Relations by working with internal and external teams

additionalPlain:
#LI- LH1


Why Match Group?

Our mission is simple – to help people find love and happiness! We love our employees too and understand the importance of all life's milestones.  Here are some of the benefits we are proud to offer: 

Mind & Body – Medical, mental health, and wellness benefits to support your overall health and well-being
Financial Wellness – Competitive compensation, 100% employer match on 401k contributions up to 10% (cap at $10,000), as well as an employee stock purchase program to help you feel supported in your financial security
Unplug – Generous PTO and 18 paid holidays so you can unplug
Career – Annual training allowance for professional development and ERG membership opportunities and events so you feel connected and empowered in your work
Family – Families come in all shapes and sizes so we offer 20 weeks of 100% paid parental leave, fertility, adoption, and child care resources, as well as pet insurance and discounts  
Company Gatherings – We host fun happy hours and company events where our employees get to know each other 	and build a sense of connection and belonging!

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we value the rich dynamics that diversity brings to our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sexual orientation, sex (including pregnancy and sexual harassment), gender identity or expression, uniformed service or veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic.  Period. 

If you require reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, or a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, please contact employeebenefits@matchgroup.com.

descriptionPlain:
The  Indirect Tax Accounting and Compliance Manager will report to the Tax Director and will facilitate the accounting for  global indirect tax activities  in addition to assisting with management of global indirect tax compliance. 

Know where you belong. Match Group is a leading provider of dating products across the globe. Our portfolio includes Tinder, Match, Hinge, PlentyOfFish, The League, and others, each designed to spark meaningful connections for singles worldwide. Creating a sense of belonging doesn’t stop at our products - it’s the foundation of every team we hire.

When it comes to dating, the connection starts online, but the real magic happens once you meet in real life (IRL).  We think the same is true for creating the best platforms, so we work together IRL in our Dallas office 3 days/week.
description:
The  Indirect Tax Accounting and Compliance Manager will report to the Tax Director and will facilitate the accounting for  global indirect tax activities  in addition to assisting with management of global indirect tax compliance. 

Know where you belong. Match Group is a leading provider of dating products across the globe. Our portfolio includes Tinder, Match, Hinge, PlentyOfFish, The League, and others, each designed to spark meaningful connections for singles worldwide. Creating a sense of belonging doesn’t stop at our products - it’s the foundation of every team we hire.

When it comes to dating, the connection starts online, but the real magic happens once you meet in real life (IRL).  We think the same is true for creating the best platforms, so we work together IRL in our Dallas office 3 days/week.

lists.content:
• You will support SOX reporting and maintenance of strong internal controls.
  • You will collaborate with key partners in accounting, revenue, treasury, and finance to achieve shared goals.
  • You will manage monthly close activities, ensuring accurate and timely financial reporting.
  • You will identify opportunities to streamline and automate indirect tax accounting functions.
  • You will drive continuous improvement and support the adoption of new processes and technologies.
  • You will analyze, review and file required global indirect tax returns and track associated due dates and payments.
  • You will perform monthly invoice analysis for VAT returns and maintenance of VAT accrual guides
  • You will track global revenue by entity by country to determine when new registrations are required on a quarterly basis.
  • You will maintain the organization's compliance calendars for all indirect taxes and confirm all taxes are being filed/paid where required/applicable.
  • You will monitor and interpret tax law changes and the impact on tax positions and calculations.
  • You will support internal and external audit requirements.
  • You will research the needs or requirements of indirect taxes in the event of the opening of a new location or acquisition.
  • You will perform ongoing review and research of domestic and international tax laws, court decisions, and administrative pronouncements to ensure the company's compliance and find opportunities for tax savings.
  • You will assist Tax Manager with maintenance of nexus and taxability in Vertex and OneSource.
  • You will help with special projects, ad hoc analysis, other tasks as requested by Tax Director.

lists.text: We could be a match if:
lists.content:
• You have a BA/BS in Accounting or Finance degree.
  • You have 5+ years of relevant accounting work experience. 
  • You have indirect tax compliance experience including VAT/GST/Sales and Use preferred.
  • You have demonstrated ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects concurrently.
  • You have strong accounting and analytical skills.
  • You have excellent tax research abilities.
  • You have familiarity with broad tax concepts and associated business effects.
  • You have strong computer skills; proficiency in MS Office, Alteryx preferred.
  • You have the ability to organize, prioritize, problem solve, take initiative, and maintain confidentiality of sensitive information.
  • You have excellent communication and problem solving skills.
  • You have a willingness to broaden general tax knowledge.
  • You have demonstrated ability to work well independently and as a member of a team with little supervision.

text: Indirect Tax Accounting and Compliance Manager
descriptionBody:
The  Indirect Tax Accounting and Compliance Manager will report to the Tax Director and will facilitate the accounting for  global indirect tax activities  in addition to assisting with management of global indirect tax compliance. 

Know where you belong. Match Group is a leading provider of dating products across the globe. Our portfolio includes Tinder, Match, Hinge, PlentyOfFish, The League, and others, each designed to spark meaningful connections for singles worldwide. Creating a sense of belonging doesn’t stop at our products - it’s the foundation of every team we hire.

When it comes to dating, the connection starts online, but the real magic happens once you meet in real life (IRL).  We think the same is true for creating the best platforms, so we work together IRL in our Dallas office 3 days/week.

descriptionPlain:
Meetic is the European leader in dating services operating across 21 countries. As the source of more than 8 million couples, Meetic works to create the best user experience whether online, mobile or at the many events organized every week across Europe.

A company focusing on a human philosophy, supported by the strength of an international group, our teams develop products with a strong social impact.
In recent years, Meetic has placed people and sustainability at the center of its focus through concrete actions: such as a green IT approach (reduction of servers, web eco-design, zero plastic...), friendly work environment, emergency leaves, WFH policy, work-life balance etc…

Take a look at our page:https://www.meetic-europe.com/

lists.content:
• With your Squad (Reveal) made up of devs (Front, Back, Mobile), QA, PO, PM, UX/UI designer, Scrum master, you contribute to the development of tomorrow's dating apps!
  • At the same time, you contribute to our iOS community made up of 4 developers of all levels and a Tech Lead.

• Full Swift, Xcode, UIKit / SwiftUI frameworks
  • Modularization, VIPER architecture
  • Clean architecture, gitflow, Jenkins
  • Unit and functional tests (XCTest) / TDD
  • Librairies : SwiftGen, PromiseKit, Swinject...

• At Meetic we are aware of the importance of our mission for our users, which is why we are committed to a process of continuous pursuit of excellence, in a caring environment.

  • You produce quality code, tested and maintainable by the team.
  • You are autonomous and responsible of each step of development chain: implementation, testing, continuation of the application architecture until production.
  • Immersed in a squad, you will be responsible for the development of new features and will participate with the iOS community in the maintenance and technical development of Meetic applications.
  • In workshops and communities of practice, you are involved in inventing, with the Product and the Design, new functionalities.
  • You have ideas and you implement them to make the user experience pleasant and fun.
  • For us, robustness goes hand in hand with scalability, agility and innovation.

• At least 5 years of experience on native iOS app development (Swift, Xcode)

  • Experience in Agile (Scrum) methodology
  • Teamwork, communication and work autonomy
  • Interest in craftsmanship
  • Spoken and written English ; be able to communicate in day-to-day activities

    • Must Have :
  • Swift, UIKit, Xcode, modularization, gitflow
  • Clean Code and Clean Architecture best practices
  • Librairies : SwiftGen, PromiseKit, Swinject...

    • Nice to Have :
  • SwitfUI framework, VIPER / MVVM architectures, Jenkins
  • Unit and functional tests (XCTest) / TDD

additionalPlain:
Commitment to Inclusion

At Tinder, we don’t just accept difference, we celebrate it. We strive to build a workplace that reflects the rich diversity of our members around the world, and we value unique perspectives and backgrounds. Even if you don’t meet all the listed qualifications, we invite you to apply and show us how your skills could transfer. Tinder is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace where we welcome people of all sexes, gender identities, races, ethnicities, disabilities, and other lived experiences. Learn more here: https://www.lifeattinder.com/dei


If you require reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, or a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, please contact employeebenefits@matchgroup.com.

descriptionPlain:
Our Mission

As humans, there are few things more exciting than meeting someone new. At Tinder, we’re inspired by the challenge of keeping the magic of human connection alive. With tens of millions of users, hundreds of millions of downloads, 2+ billion swipes per day, 20+ million matches per day, and a presence in 190+ countries, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing.
 
We work together to solve complex problems. Behind the simplicity of every match, we think deeply about human relationships, behavioral science, network economics, AI and ML, online and real-world safety, cultural nuances, loneliness, love, sex, and more.

The Team

There are internships and then there's the Tindership program. Forget boring busywork—spend your summer as part of our team, making a real impact on our business. Tinder interns gain a meaningful experience connecting with their mentor and managers, participating in large-scale projects, and collaborating with other interns in our flagship Tindership hackathon. You’ll join an inclusive workplace and gain real-world experiences and exposure to Tinder's culture. 

About the Role

As an iOS intern at Tinder, you will partner directly with senior members of the mobile team and be empowered to contribute solutions to the Tinder codebase. We are deeply invested in challenging norms, constantly improving architecture design, exploring emergent tech and ideas, and leveraging new technologies in interesting ways to deliver an app that is widely known the world over. 

Where you'll work

This is a hybrid role and requires in-office collaboration three days per week. The position will be located in Los Angeles, CA.

lists.content:
• Collaborate on the development, implementation and  functionality of Tinder's newest features and platform architecture
  • Build robust, lasting, and scalable products that serve millions of users
  • Work on systems that handle billions of data events a day
  • Leverage large scale multi-channel communications to keep users well-informed (push notifications, emails, in-app messaging, and more)
  • Write unit and integration tests 
  • Participate in the annual Tindership Hackathon, presenting with your team to the entire Tinder team and panel of executives.

• Aspiring iOS developer who’s excited to work on large scale challenges with cutting-edge technology
  • Proficiency in coding with Swift 
  • Foundational knowledge of basic Computer Science principles: data structures and algorithms.
  • Currently pursuing a BS/BA, MS, or PhD in Computer Science or a related field (Graduation date of December 2024 onward)

• Prior Internship or work experience on a native mobile application
  • Completed mobile project experience (i.e. hack-a-thons, personal projects, GitHub, Open Source, volunteer coding experience etc.)
  • Familiarity with architecture frameworks such as MVC, MVVM, Viper etc
  • Aware of native app development tools/concepts like xcode, core data, core animation, dependency injection, combine, swift UI, UI kit etc. is not required but a bonus

lists.text: As part of our team, you'll enjoy:
lists.content:
• The liveliness of a startup with the impact of a global business
  • Collaborating with a team of creative, fun and driven colleagues 
  • Working with an extraordinary team of smart, creative, fun, and highly motivated people
  • Competitive hourly pay and flexible working schedule
  • Comprehensive health coverage, 401(k) 
  • Access to mental health resources
  • Virtual yoga and fitness classes, and many other fun activities
  • Virtual celebrations, parties, socials, and more
  • A robust Learning + Development offering including our MentorMatch program, access to a library of 6,000+ online learning courses through Udemy
  • Fully customized computer equipment to fit your needs
  • The opportunity to join 8+ active Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)

salaryDescription: Factors such as scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, job-related skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and business considerations may influence base pay offered. This salary range is reflective of a position based in Los Angeles. This salary will be subject to a geographic adjustment (according to a specific city and state), if an authorization is granted to work outside of the location listed in this posting.

descriptionPlain:
[Hyper-X]


“우리는 최신 기술을 활용한 글로벌 제품을 만듭니다.”

Hyper-X 팀의 미션은, 현 시대의 최신 기술들을 활용하여 세상에 임팩트를 줄 수 있는 프로덕트를 만들고, 글로벌 시장에 출시하여 더 많은 사용자들과 새로운 경험을 나누는 것입니다. 창업한 그 순간부터 늘 창조적인 길을 개척해 온 하이퍼커넥트의 DNA와 혁신적인 기술, 그리고 매치그룹의 탄탄한 지원을 바탕으로 글로벌을 향한 도전을 계속합니다.

팀에 합류하시면,
- 상상력과 열정을 발휘할 수 있는 팀과 함께 Zero to One을 만들어갈 수 있습니다.
- 글로벌 시장에서 성공 경험을 이끈 하이퍼커넥트 멤버들과 Match Group의 글로벌 팀과 협업할 수 있습니다.
- 모든 멤버가 자신의 전문 분야를 뛰어넘어 자유롭게 의견을 나누고 협력하는 문화를 경험할 수 있습니다.


Responsibilities

Feature
- Azar, Hakuna 에서 축적된 노하우의 도움을 받아, 신규서비스를 구현하고 운영합니다
- 디자인, API, QA 등 다른 직무의 동료들과 협업하며 목표 달성을 위한 최적의 방안을 찾아 구현합니다.
- 자신이 개발한 기능에 대해서 담당을 하는 동시에 다른 팀원들에게 관련 코드를 전파하여, 기능별로 weak code ownership 에서 collective code ownership 으로 넘어갈 수 있도록 합니다.

Code review
- 자신이 작성한 코드가 아니어도 서로 이해하고 필요한 경우 누구든 수정할 수 있도록, 상시적인 Pull request 기반의 코드리뷰를 합니다.

Troubleshooting
- 배포된 애플리케이션이 우리가 기대한 쾌적한 경험을 만들고 있는지를 모니터링하며, 문제가 있다면 최대한 빠르게 해결합니다.
- Crash를 줄이고 Responsiveness를 최대한 높이기 위해 상시적인 작업을 하고 있으며, 그 외에도 다양한 네트웍/연결 지표등을 실시간으로 모니터링하며 서비스의 동작이 예측 가능한 품질을 유지하도록 합니다.

Architectural improvement
- 새로운 기술이나 패러다임을 도입하여 장기적으로 생산성을 높일 수 있다면 적극적으로 고려합니다.
- 일관성 있고 예측 가능한 구조, 더 유연하고 강력한 도구들을 사용하여 전체 코드의 가독성을 높이고 의도치 않은 사이드 이펙트를 줄입니다.

- 일관성 있고 예측 가능한 구조, 더 유연하고 강력한 도구들을 사용하여 전체 코드의 가독성을 높이고 의도치 않은 사이드 이펙트를 줄입니다.

lists.content:
• iOS 개발 경력 4년 이상 보유하신 분
  • Swift/Objective-C 를 기반으로 UIKit, Foundation 등을 사용하는 iOS 플랫폼에서 상용 서비스 개발 경험을 보유하신 분
  • Server-Client간 시스템의 흐름을 이해하고 문제를 찾고 해결책을 제시할 수 있는 역량을 보유하신 분
  • 알고리즘, 디자인 패턴 및 공통적으로 사용되는 프레임워크에 대한 탄탄한 기초지식 및 종합적인 이해를 보유하신 분
  • 시스템 안정성과 효율성 제고를 주도한 경험을 보유하신 분

• Unit 테스트 작성과 mocking에 대한 경험이 많거나, 흥미가 많으신 분
  • 코드 보안에 관심 많으신 분
  • 내부 세미나 또는 블로깅 등의 방법으로 본인의 지식을 공유하는 것을 즐기시는 분
  • 복잡한 비즈니스 요구사항을 분석하고 확장 가능한 테크 솔루션으로 이를 단순화할 수 있는 역량을 보유하고 계신 분
  • 다양한 관련 기술에 대한 솔루션과 운영체제에 대한 깊은 이해를 보유하신 분
  • 데이터를 통해 의사결정하고 액션아이템을 도출하여 실행할 수 있는 역량을 보유하신 분

• 정의되지 않은 과제를 정의하고 스스로 해결책을 찾아 해결합니다.
  • 팀 단위 프로젝트를 성공적으로 리딩할 수 있으며, 팀간 협업을 이끌고 다른 기능의 직군 파트너와 협업합니다.
  • 팀 안팎으로 커뮤니케이션하며 내 메시지를 청자에 맞추어 적절한 수준에서 명확하고 간결하게 제시합니다.
  • 팀 간의 협업 과정을 조정하고 결과물을 만들 수 있도록 지원합니다.

• 고용 형태: 정규직
  • 채용 절차: 서류전형 > 1차 면접 > 2차 면접 > 3차면접(해당 시) > 최종 합격
  • 근무 시간: 근무시간을 자율적으로 선택하는DIY(Do It Yourself) 근무제
  • 지원 서류: 자유 양식의 상세 경력기반 국문 또는 영문이력서(PDF)

• 하이퍼커넥트는 증명사진, 주민등록번호, 가족관계, 혼인여부 등 채용과 관계없는 개인정보를 요구하지 않습니다.
  • 수습기간 중 급여 등 처우에 차등이 없습니다.
  • 제출해 주신 내용 중 허위 사실이 있을 경우 채용이 취소될 수 있습니다.
  • 필요 시 사전에 안내된 채용 절차 외에도 추가 면접 전형이 진행될 수 있습니다.
  • 필요 시 지원자의 동의 하에 평판조회 절차가 진행될 수 있으며, 평판조회 결과에 따라 채용이 취소될 수 있습니다.
  • 병역특례요원의 경우, 병역특례 관련법에 따라 복무관리를 진행합니다.

descriptionBody:
[Hyper-X]


“우리는 최신 기술을 활용한 글로벌 제품을 만듭니다.”

Hyper-X 팀의 미션은, 현 시대의 최신 기술들을 활용하여 세상에 임팩트를 줄 수 있는 프로덕트를 만들고, 글로벌 시장에 출시하여 더 많은 사용자들과 새로운 경험을 나누는 것입니다. 창업한 그 순간부터 늘 창조적인 길을 개척해 온 하이퍼커넥트의 DNA와 혁신적인 기술, 그리고 매치그룹의 탄탄한 지원을 바탕으로 글로벌을 향한 도전을 계속합니다.

팀에 합류하시면,
- 상상력과 열정을 발휘할 수 있는 팀과 함께 Zero to One을 만들어갈 수 있습니다.
- 글로벌 시장에서 성공 경험을 이끈 하이퍼커넥트 멤버들과 Match Group의 글로벌 팀과 협업할 수 있습니다.
- 모든 멤버가 자신의 전문 분야를 뛰어넘어 자유롭게 의견을 나누고 협력하는 문화를 경험할 수 있습니다.


Responsibilities

Feature
- Azar, Hakuna 에서 축적된 노하우의 도움을 받아, 신규서비스를 구현하고 운영합니다
- 디자인, API, QA 등 다른 직무의 동료들과 협업하며 목표 달성을 위한 최적의 방안을 찾아 구현합니다.
- 자신이 개발한 기능에 대해서 담당을 하는 동시에 다른 팀원들에게 관련 코드를 전파하여, 기능별로 weak code ownership 에서 collective code ownership 으로 넘어갈 수 있도록 합니다.

Code review
- 자신이 작성한 코드가 아니어도 서로 이해하고 필요한 경우 누구든 수정할 수 있도록, 상시적인 Pull request 기반의 코드리뷰를 합니다.

Troubleshooting
- 배포된 애플리케이션이 우리가 기대한 쾌적한 경험을 만들고 있는지를 모니터링하며, 문제가 있다면 최대한 빠르게 해결합니다.
- Crash를 줄이고 Responsiveness를 최대한 높이기 위해 상시적인 작업을 하고 있으며, 그 외에도 다양한 네트웍/연결 지표등을 실시간으로 모니터링하며 서비스의 동작이 예측 가능한 품질을 유지하도록 합니다.

Architectural improvement
- 새로운 기술이나 패러다임을 도입하여 장기적으로 생산성을 높일 수 있다면 적극적으로 고려합니다.
- 일관성 있고 예측 가능한 구조, 더 유연하고 강력한 도구들을 사용하여 전체 코드의 가독성을 높이고 의도치 않은 사이드 이펙트를 줄입니다.

  • Swift/Objective-C 를 기반으로 UIKit, Foundation 등을 사용하는 iOS 플랫폼에서 상용 서비스 개발 경험을 보유하신 분
  • Server-Client간 시스템의 흐름을 이해하고 문제를 찾고 해결책을 제시할 수 있는 역량을 보유하신 분
  • 알고리즘, 디자인 패턴 및 공통적으로 사용되는 프레임워크에 대한 탄탄한 기초지식 및 종합적인 이해를 보유하신 분
  • 시스템 안정성과 효율성 제고를 주도한 경험을 보유하신 분

• Unit 테스트 작성과 mocking에 대한 경험이 많거나, 흥미가 많으신 분
  • 코드 보안에 관심 많으신 분
  • 내부 세미나 또는 블로깅 등의 방법으로 본인의 지식을 공유하는 것을 즐기시는 분
  • 복잡한 비즈니스 요구사항을 분석하고 확장 가능한 테크 솔루션으로 이를 단순화할 수 있는 역량을 보유하고 계신 분
  • 다양한 관련 기술에 대한 솔루션과 운영체제에 대한 깊은 이해를 보유하신 분
  • 데이터를 통해 의사결정하고 액션아이템을 도출하여 실행할 수 있는 역량을 보유하신 분

• 정의되지 않은 과제를 정의하고 스스로 해결책을 찾아 해결합니다.
  • 팀 단위 프로젝트를 성공적으로 리딩할 수 있으며, 팀간 협업을 이끌고 다른 기능의 직군 파트너와 협업합니다.
  • 팀 안팎으로 커뮤니케이션하며 내 메시지를 청자에 맞추어 적절한 수준에서 명확하고 간결하게 제시합니다.
  • 팀 간의 협업 과정을 조정하고 결과물을 만들 수 있도록 지원합니다.

• 고용 형태: 정규직
  • 채용 절차: 서류전형 > 1차 면접 > 2차 면접 > 3차면접(해당 시) > 최종 합격
  • 근무 시간: 근무시간을 자율적으로 선택하는DIY(Do It Yourself) 근무제
  • 지원 서류: 자유 양식의 상세 경력기반 국문 또는 영문이력서(PDF)

• 하이퍼커넥트는 증명사진, 주민등록번호, 가족관계, 혼인여부 등 채용과 관계없는 개인정보를 요구하지 않습니다.
  • 수습기간 중 급여 등 처우에 차등이 없습니다.
  • 제출해 주신 내용 중 허위 사실이 있을 경우 채용이 취소될 수 있습니다.
  • 필요 시 사전에 안내된 채용 절차 외에도 추가 면접 전형이 진행될 수 있습니다.
  • 필요 시 지원자의 동의 하에 평판조회 절차가 진행될 수 있으며, 평판조회 결과에 따라 채용이 취소될 수 있습니다.
  • 병역특례요원의 경우, 병역특례 관련법에 따라 복무관리를 진행합니다.

descriptionBody:
[Hyper-X]


“우리는 최신 기술을 활용한 글로벌 제품을 만듭니다.”

Hyper-X 팀의 미션은, 현 시대의 최신 기술들을 활용하여 세상에 임팩트를 줄 수 있는 프로덕트를 만들고, 글로벌 시장에 출시하여 더 많은 사용자들과 새로운 경험을 나누는 것입니다. 창업한 그 순간부터 늘 창조적인 길을 개척해 온 하이퍼커넥트의 DNA와 혁신적인 기술, 그리고 매치그룹의 탄탄한 지원을 바탕으로 글로벌을 향한 도전을 계속합니다.

팀에 합류하시면,
- 상상력과 열정을 발휘할 수 있는 팀과 함께 Zero to One을 만들어갈 수 있습니다.
- 글로벌 시장에서 성공 경험을 이끈 하이퍼커넥트 멤버들과 Match Group의 글로벌 팀과 협업할 수 있습니다.
- 모든 멤버가 자신의 전문 분야를 뛰어넘어 자유롭게 의견을 나누고 협력하는 문화를 경험할 수 있습니다.


Responsibilities

Feature
- Azar, Hakuna 에서 축적된 노하우의 도움을 받아, 신규서비스를 구현하고 운영합니다
- 디자인, API, QA 등 다른 직무의 동료들과 협업하며 목표 달성을 위한 최적의 방안을 찾아 구현합니다.
- 자신이 개발한 기능에 대해서 담당을 하는 동시에 다른 팀원들에게 관련 코드를 전파하여, 기능별로 weak code ownership 에서 collective code ownership 으로 넘어갈 수 있도록 합니다.

Code review
- 자신이 작성한 코드가 아니어도 서로 이해하고 필요한 경우 누구든 수정할 수 있도록, 상시적인 Pull request 기반의 코드리뷰를 합니다.

Troubleshooting
- 배포된 애플리케이션이 우리가 기대한 쾌적한 경험을 만들고 있는지를 모니터링하며, 문제가 있다면 최대한 빠르게 해결합니다.
- Crash를 줄이고 Responsiveness를 최대한 높이기 위해 상시적인 작업을 하고 있으며, 그 외에도 다양한 네트웍/연결 지표등을 실시간으로 모니터링하며 서비스의 동작이 예측 가능한 품질을 유지하도록 합니다.

Architectural improvement
- 새로운 기술이나 패러다임을 도입하여 장기적으로 생산성을 높일 수 있다면 적극적으로 고려합니다.
- 일관성 있고 예측 가능한 구조, 더 유연하고 강력한 도구들을 사용하여 전체 코드의 가독성을 높이고 의도치 않은 사이드 이펙트를 줄입니다.

Commitment to Inclusion

At Tinder, we don’t just accept difference, we celebrate it. We strive to build a workplace that reflects the rich diversity of our members around the world, and we value unique perspectives and backgrounds. Even if you don’t meet all the listed qualifications, we invite you to apply and show us how your skills could transfer. Tinder is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace where we welcome people of all sexes, gender identities, races, ethnicities, disabilities, and other lived experiences. Learn more here: https://www.lifeattinder.com/dei

If you require reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, or a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, please contact employeebenefits@matchgroup.com.

descriptionPlain:
Our Mission

As humans, there are few things more exciting than meeting someone new. At Tinder, we’re inspired by the challenge of keeping the magic of human connection alive. With tens of millions of users, hundreds of millions of downloads, 2+ billion swipes per day, 20+ million matches per day, and a presence in 190+ countries, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing.
 
We work together to solve complex problems. Behind the simplicity of every match, we think deeply about human relationships, behavioral science, network economics, AI and ML, online and real-world safety, cultural nuances, loneliness, love, sex, and more.

We're seeking a Lead People Business Partner to join our People team. The ideal candidate should be a top-tier HR professional who's ambitious, has excellent judgment, and is eager to get things done. If you’re passionate about employee experience and thrive in a vibrant environment, this is the ideal role for you!

This is a hybrid role and requires in-office collaboration three days per week. This position can be located in Palo Alto, CA or San Francisco, CA.

Our Mission

We work together to solve complex problems. Behind the simplicity of every match, we think deeply about human relationships, behavioral science, network economics, AI and ML, online and real-world safety, cultural nuances, loneliness, love, sex, and more.

We're seeking a Lead People Business Partner to join our People team. The ideal candidate should be a top-tier HR professional who's ambitious, has excellent judgment, and is eager to get things done. If you’re passionate about employee experience and thrive in a vibrant environment, this is the ideal role for you!

This is a hybrid role and requires in-office collaboration three days per week. This position can be located in Palo Alto, CA or San Francisco, CA.

lists.content:
• Serve as a mentor to the People Business Partner team to support leaders and employees within the organization.
  • Drive change management efforts, ensuring employee and stakeholder impact are at the forefront of decisions and that changes are executed based on company values.
  • Be a key resource for employees, providing support and direction about employment issues, benefits, leaves, and company policies.
  • Build trust based relationships with people leaders, understand their business needs, and partner with them on people decisions.
  • In support of Tinder’s Talent Management philosophies, train and coach managers through the performance review process, including how to have effective feedback conversations, facilitating career development discussions and creating a culture of real time feedback.
  • Able to analyze compensation information and keep apprised of market trends in order to partner with business leaders and Match Group through annual compensation processes and provide guidance to managers.
  • Provide day-to-day mentorship and coaching to develop leaders at all levels throughout the organization; maintain a high bar for what we value, leadership principles, and overall workplace behavior.
  • Support the launch and ongoing delivery of performance management programs.
  • Facilitate the off-boarding process and conduct exit interviews.
  • Partner with our Talent Acquisition team and department leaders to drive organizational planning and design initiatives to identify long-term team personnel resourcing needs.
  • Support and partner with recruiters to provide a quality experience to candidates throughout the recruitment process, including compensation recommendations commensurate with the market.
  • Coordinate with our Talent Management/Learning & Development team to review People Survey results and support leaders in the development, implementation, and communication of strategic action plans that measurably improve engagement and retention.
  • Counsel and coach leaders on matters concerning employee relations.
  • Partner with Match Group Benefits team and people leaders to provide support to employees throughout their entire benefits journey, including leaves of absence and accommodation requests.
  • Partner with DE&I teams on driving local programs and initiatives aimed at improving inclusion and representation.
  • Partner with the Match Group Immigration team to provide people leaders and employees support for all immigration processes.
  • Keep apprised of federal, state and local employment laws and regulations in order to ensure company compliance; including recommendations for FLSA compliance.

• 7+ years of HR experience at a tech start-up or rapidly scaling company, with experience providing strategic business partnering to Sr. leaders
  • 3+ years as a people leader/mentor
  • Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent years of experience (e.g. Business, Human resources, Psychology, Sociology, Organizational Development, Strategic Management, etc.)
  • Experience with core HR domains, including performance management, organizational design, talent management, compensation, employee relations and compliance
  • Able to maintain strict confidentiality with employee information
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with an emphasis on customer service
  • Strong collaboration and stakeholder management skills
  • Track record of establishing effective working relationships and comfortable working with remote teams
  • Highly experienced with Google Suite and high level proficiency in MS Office Suite; familiarity with various HR systems (Workday, Lever, etc.)

• Experience directly supporting software development teams
  • High EQ and interpersonal skills
  • Familiarity with 9-box talent calibration assessments
  • Prior experience with investigative processes
  • Interest and experience working in a collaborative and fast-paced environment

lists.text: As a full time employee, you'll enjoy:
lists.content:
• Unlimited PTO (with no waiting period), 10 annual Wellness Days
  • Time off to volunteer and charitable donations matched up to $15,000 annually
  • Comprehensive health, vision, and dental coverage
  • 100% 401(k) employer match up to 10%, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
  • 100% paid parental leave (including for non-birthing parents), family forming benefits, and Milk Stork, which provides access to breast milk shipping for business travel, surrogacy, and employee relocation
  • Investment in your development: mentorship through our MentorMatch program, access to 6,000+ online courses through Udemy, and an annual $3,000 stipend for your professional development
  • Investment in your wellness: access to mental health support via Modern Health, BetterHelp, and Insight Timer; paid concierge medical membership, pet insurance, fitness membership subsidy, and commuter subsidy
  • Free subscription to Tinder Gold

salaryDescription: Factors such as scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, job-related skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and business considerations may influence base pay offered. This salary range is reflective of a position based in the Bay Area. . This salary will be subject to a geographic adjustment (according to a specific city and state), if an authorization is granted to work outside of the location listed in this posting.

Why Plenty of Fish?
•     We're recognized as one of BC's Top Employers 2023! 
•     Generous vacation, flex days, professional development days 
•     RRSP matching, and employee stock purchase plan 
•     Professional development budget and unlimited access to Udemy from day one
•     Match Group mentorship program
•     Parental leave top up and fertility preservation benefits
•     Extended health & dental benefits from day one
•     Corporate ClassPass membership and other wellness benefits 
•     And many more on our careers page

Our Values
•     Be Proud - We own our ship. We see challenges as opportunities and take action. 
•     Make Waves - We profoundly impact millions of peoples' lives, every day.
•     Dive Deep - We empathize with our members and use data to surface thoughtful decisions.
•     Crew Together - We're all working towards the same goals and win as a team.
